column4: Guys, I have downloaded nvidia's new driver for ubuntu with "apt-get install nvidia-current nvidia-settings"
But it dosn't seems I can increase resolution or anything
so, heh, I am stucked here
what does xrandr report for resolutions?
Well, xrandr tells me my current resolution
also, have you rebooted after installing the driver?
And it dosn't list other resolutions
does your card come up with lspci?
If you are doubting that, it is properly connected or not, then I must tell you I have windows as second OS and I have it perfectly working in there
not doubting the physical install, just seems that the driver isn't loading properly. You may have to blacklist another default vid driver?
